alert.note: Alert for Eastern Curry County and Josephine County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued November 05 at 10:53AM PST until November 06 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: .A period of moderate to heavy rainfall is expected late this afternoon and overnight across the Flat burn scar. Scattered thunderstorms will produce convectively enhanced rainfall rates and increase the potential for debris flows. ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR THE FLAT BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Periods of moderate to heavy rainfall is expected late this afternoon and overnight. There is a low probability that this heavy rainfall could trigger flash flooding and/or debris flows on the Flat burn scar. * WHERE...The Flat burn scar in eastern Curry County. * WHEN...From 4 PM PST this afternoon through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Moderate to heavy rainfall could trigger flash flooding of low-lying areas and debris flows in and near recent wildfire burn scars. The heaviest rainfall is most likely in thunderstorms between 1900 tonight and 0400 Monday morning. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Total rainfall amounts of 1.5 to 2.5 inches of is expected over an 18 hour period across the Flat burn scar. Higher rainfall rates in thunderstorms, which could approach 1 inch per hour, will increase the threat. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Curry County and Josephine County
